tweet: Despite existing protections, pregnant workers in the U.S. still face workplace discrimination across industry and state. Women of color and immigrants may be at particular risk. That's why I'm proud to cosponsor the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act and #ProtectPregnantWorkers

As a member of one of the investigating committees, I have been present, along with 47 Republicans, for private depositions. It is critical that the American people now hear about the President’s wrongdoing. No one is above the law, not even the President.

We have entered a new phase of the impeachment inquiry process. Evidence has been collected, witnesses have been deposed, and now there will be public hearings and procedures for the President and his counsel to respond to evidence.

States that refused to expand Medicaid under the ACA have seen the rate of uninsured children 3x as large as states that have expanded. Kids should not have to suffer because TN has not expanded Medicaid.

America has joined with European allies in strongly condemning Turkey’s invasion of Syria and attacks on the Kurdish people. Turkey’s ruthless aggression has to have serious consequences. https://twitter.com/NBCNews/status/1186352114685100033 …

Turkey’s attacks on the Kurdish people and their invasion of Syria cannot go unpunished. I signed on as a co-sponsor of the bipartisan Protect Against Conflict by Turkey (PACT) Act. PACT imposes sanctions on Turkey for their inexcusable and merciless actions against the Kurds.

Along with several physicians and people with severe medical conditions, I expressed my concerns about Tennessee’s Medicaid Block Grant proposal at a public hearing yesterday. https://www.tennessean.com/story/news/health/2019/10/01/medicaid-block-grant-public-hearing-concerns-tenncare-health-insurance/2375727001/ …

Since 2010, Tennessee has turned down almost $9 billion by not expanding Medicaid, leading to the declining health of Tennesseans and the closure of rural hospitals. Tennessee’s Block Grant proposal is not the solution.

Tennessee’s Medicaid Block Grant proposal would be disastrous for thousands of Tennesseans, if approved. Read my full comments here: https://cooper.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/cooper-testifies-at-middle-tennessee-tenncare-block-grant-hearing …

One year from today, October 1, 2020, is the deadline to get your REAL ID license, which will be required to board a domestic flight or to enter certain federal buildings and facilities. To learn more about a REAL ID and what documents you need, go to http://cooper.house.gov/additional-services-and-resources/real-id …
